snippet: The inmate, Gerald Koch, a self-described anarchist, had said he would not cooperate with what he called a fishing expedition against his political associations.
abstract: Gerald Koch, Brooklyn man held in jail for eight months because of his refusal to testify before a grand jury that was believed to be examining a 2008 explosion in Times Square, wins his release; Judge John F Keenan of Federal District Court in Manhattan determined that Koch's incarceration had changed from coercive to punitive and would not change his intention to refuse to testify.
lead_paragraph: The inmate, Gerald Koch, a self-described anarchist, had said he would not cooperate with what he called a fishing expedition against his political associations.

headline.main: In Switch, Refusal to Testify Wins a Brooklyn Man His Freedom
headline.print_headline: His Refusal to Testify Wins Freedom for Brooklyn Man
